text: The Lesser Polish Way of Saint James is a popular pilgrimage route in Eastern Europe. This route was created in Poland. It starts in the city of Sandomierz, and end sin the city of Krakow. It began in medieval times when many pilgrims travelled through Europe to Santiago de Compostela. The other places on The Lesser Polish Way are: Klimontów, Szczaworyż, Wiślica, and Więcławice. == Other websites == * Website of parish of St. James in Więcławice with description of the route in Polish * Possible accommodation * Facebook Funpage Category:Religion in Poland
title: The Lesser Polish Way of Saint James
